tweet: It is time to end this unnecessary shutdown & put the federal government fully back to work serving the American people. I hope the Senate will act swiftly & approve these measures with the same strong support it did before. I urge the President to sign these bills without delay.

Each of these will be identical to measures that unanimously passed the Senate Appropriations Committee during the 115th Congress, four of which passed the full Senate, with the addition of a measure to ensure back pay for federal workers furloughed because of the #TrumpShutdown.

When Dems assume control of the House, I will bring two bills to the Floor aimed at ending @POTUS’ costly & dangerous #TrumpShutdown. The 1st will be 6 of 7 remaining appropriations bills for FY 2019, & the 2nd will fund @DHSgov at current levels to 2/8.  http://bit.ly/2BNIPuk

Serving the people of Maryland is my greatest honor, and I will continue working hard to deliver for families in #MD05. If my office can be of assistance in the new year, please reach out.  https://hoyer.house.gov/#help-front

2018 was a busy year in #MD05 and on Capitol Hill. While I am deeply disappointed the year is ending with a #TrumpShutdown, I look forward to working on behalf of MD families in 2019, including reopening govt as soon as possible. pic.twitter.com/Cn8zxTXNed

Republicans’ strategy of shutting down the government is harmful to our federal employees and the public they serve, and it undermines the confidence of the international community. Watch as I discuss the #TrumpShutdown on @CBSEveningNews: pic.twitter.com/Wh3ghndt8L

I joined #MTPDaily today to urge @realDonaldTrump & GOP leadership to end the #TrumpShutdown. If they continue this shutdown, Democrats will offer a bill on January 3 when we take control of the House to reopen government & ensure federal employees receive the pay they are due. pic.twitter.com/uHf4FzB5Lq
